Rounding
This is the number of decimal points you wish to round this currency to when it is publicly displayed. Internally, the actual amount will still be used in formulas.

Uses Table Prefix <dfn>Generally, this should be set to Yes unless you know you need it turned off.</dfn>
User Column <dfn>Database column that contains the user_id or username as above.</dfn>
Uses User ID <dfn>Otherwise the table will be joined by username.</dfn>
Relative value

This is the overall value of this currency compared to all other currencies. Generally this only matters when determining total assets and transferring between currencies. You should establish at least one currency with a value of 1 as a base against the rest.

This setting uses the Navigation Manager's position.
If you have DragonByte Shop installed and the navbar tab enabled, you can integrate Credits' links with it.
Enable Right Side Navbar Tab
This will enable a navbar tab on the right hand side (where the "Alert" and "Inbox" tabs are).
Enable navbar text

This is the amount (in {currency}) that other members will have to pay in order to see this content.
Entries to show per page
Event
Send alert
Sends a message to the user when they trigger this event.
Include guest event triggers
Maximum applications

After this event has occurred this many times, the event trigger will be skipped until the below number of seconds have passed.
0 = no maximum.
Limit maximum applications per-user
If enabled, the maximum applications are tracked separately per-user, rather than across all users.
Charged
Taxed user
Sending user
Receiving user
Both users

Sending user: The original amount + the tax will be deducted from the sending user, and the receiving user will receive the original amount.
Receiving user: The original amount will be deducted from the sending user, and the receiving user will receive the original amount minus the tax.
Both users: The original amount + the tax will be deducted from the sending user, and the receiving user will receive the original amount minus the tax.

Delay Delay (in seconds) before this event is applied. In certain scenarios, it may take longer than this before the event is fully applied.
Use 0 to apply as soon as possible.
Display in transaction log
Excluded extensions

If you wish for this event to NOT apply to certain file extensions, enter a comma-separated list.
Example: jpg,jpeg,png
Included extensions

If you wish for this event to only apply to certain file extensions, enter a comma-separated list.
Example: jpg,jpeg,png
Forums
The specific forums this event can occur in. If none are selected then all forums will be applicable. Ctrl/Cmd+click or click+drag to select more than one.
Frequency

Stagger how often this event is applied. Causes this event to be applied to every Nth valid event trigger.
Use 1 to apply this event every time this event trigger occurs.
Event is active
Is charged

The calculated value of this event will either be awarded to the user, or deducted from them if this is enabled.
When charging and the user does not have enough, the event trigger will be stopped and an error message will be displayed to the user.

The calculated value of this event will either be awarded to the user, or deducted from them if this is enabled.
When charging and the user does not have enough, the event trigger will NOT be stopped. Instead, this event will be skipped.
Flat rate

If not charging: Extra amount added to the amount being transferred.
If charging: Extra amount deducted from the amount being transferred.
Event amount

If not charging: Awarded when this event occurs.
If charging: Charged when this event occurs.
Flat rate negation

If not charging: Extra amount deducted from the amount being restored.
If charging: Extra amount added to the amount being restored.
Event negation amount

If not charging: Removed when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored when this event is reverted.
Event Management
Limit period

Timespan in seconds that the above maximum is enforced.
0 = all time.
Below Minimum {param1} Handling <dfn>Choose what should happen if the amount falls below the above minimum setting.</dfn>
Ignore extra amount
Only apply the "Event amount" to this event, ignoring the extra amount.
Skip this event
Display error message to the user
Stop all events from this event trigger
Below minimum currency handling
Choose what should happen if the currency amount falls below the minimum.
Moderate <dfn>Earning events can be held for approval in the transaction manager. Until rejected, moderated events count towards the maximum on this page.</dfn>
Moderated
Taxation
Extra percentage in decimal form (if not charging) added to / (if charging) deducted from amount being transferred.

{param1} Amount <dfn>(If not charging) Awarded / (If charging) Charged for each {param1} along with the {param2} amount (if not charging) when / (if charging) every time this event trigger occurs.</dfn>
Taxation negation
Extra percentage in decimal form (if not charging) deducted from / (if charging) added to amount being restored.
{param1} Negation Amount <dfn>(If not charging) Charged / (If charging) Awarded for each {param1} along with the {param2} negation amount when this event is reverted.</dfn>
Maximum currency amount

Amounts larger than this will be reduced to this amount before being used in "Amount per X" calculations.
0 = no maximum.
Minimum {param1} <dfn>0 = no minimum.</dfn>
Minimum currency amount
0 = no minimum.

Currency <dfn>Enter the three-letter currency code used to identify the currency you wish to sell your credits in.</dfn>

Rating Type <dfn>You can limit this event to only certain rating types with this setting.</dfn>

If you want to restrict this event to a certain reaction, or sub-set of reactions, you can select them here.
If you choose "Any", or don't make a selection, every reaction will be allowed for this event.
Redemption reward
The amount of currency that is awarded (or taken away) when this redemption code is used.
Redemption code

This code must be entered through the currency popup in order to be redeemed.
The code is case sensitive and should be unique!
The date on which the redemption code will no longer be valid.
Maximum redemptions per user

The total number of times this can be redeemed per user.
0 = unlimited
Maximum unique redemptions

The total number of different users that can redeem this code.
0 = unlimited
Earliest time that this redemption code will be valid.

Thread ID

Event trigger options
Trophy
Random addition

A random amount between 0 and this number can be added to the event amount.
Decimal and negative numbers are okay.
Use 0 to disable.
Applicable user groups

Only members of these user group(s) will have this event applied to them. If this event affects multiple participants, f.ex. a Donate event, both the source and target users' groups must be selected in order for this event to function correctly.

Cancelable <dfn>If an event deducts more credits from a user than they have, the event trigger can be stopped.</dfn>
Can Charge <dfn>Whether events support charging for the action or if they always award credits.</dfn>

(Pro) Charge Content Tag <dfn>This BBCode will be used for designating charged content. Change this to something else to take over the tags from other content hiding plugins. Blank out this setting to disable the charged content functionality, which would expose such content for free.</dfn>

(Pro) Currency Transfer Rounding <dfn>To ease rounding issues, you can set a number of decimals that the target currency will be rounded up to that adjusts the source currency amounts accordingly when transferring or donating currency. Use 0 for whole number amounts.</dfn>
Global <dfn>If no, this event trigger occurs within different forums.</dfn>
Event Trigger ID <dfn>Machine readable label made of lowercase letters and underscores.</dfn>
Interest Interval <dfn>Number of days between each interest event trigger.</dfn>
Interest Reference <dfn>Date in YYYY-MM-DD format to calculate the interest intervals from in order to maintain consistency and predictability.</dfn>
Event Trigger Management
Trigger Event For All Participants <dfn>If no, the event will only occur once no matter how many recipients are attached to a single message.</dfn>

Multiplier If this action implements its magnitude or includes the direct transfer of currency, these are the labels for it.
Content size uses the settings in the options page for this mod.
No multiplier
Plural:
Single:
Uses content size
Uses currency
with popup
Amount per byte

If not charging: Awarded for each byte along with the event amount when this event trigger occurs.
If charging: Charged for each byte along with the event amount every time this event trigger occurs.
Negation amount per byte

If not charging: Removed for each byte along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each byte along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.
Amount per day

If not charging: Awarded for each day along with the event amount when this event trigger occurs.
If charging: Charged for each day along with the event amount every time this event trigger occurs.
Negation amount per day

If not charging: Removed for each day along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each day along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.
Amount per selectable option

If not charging: Awarded for each selectable option along with the event amount when this event trigger occurs.
If charging: Charged for each selectable option along with the event amount every time this event trigger occurs.
Negation amount per selectable option

If not charging: Removed for each selectable option along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each selectable option along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.
Amount per warning point

If not charging: Awarded for each warning point along with the event amount when this event trigger occurs.
If charging: Charged for each warning point along with the event amount every time this event trigger occurs.
Negation amount per warning point

If not charging: Removed for each warning point along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each warning point along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.
Amount per star

If not charging: Awarded for each star along with the event amount when this event trigger occurs.
If charging: Charged for each star along with the event amount every time this event trigger occurs.
Negation amount per star

If not charging: Removed for each star along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each star along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.
Amount per year

If not charging: Awarded for each year along with the event amount when this event trigger occurs.
If charging: Charged for each year along with the event amount every time this event trigger occurs.
Negation amount per year
Event Trigger Name
Maximum amount of selectable options
Below minimum number of options
Choose what should happen if the amount of selectable options is below the minimum.
Minimum amount of selectable options

Parent The name of the forum action that this event trigger operates within.
For instance, a "vote" event trigger will trigger within "Poll".
Leave this blank if you are unsure what to enter here.
Paycheck Interval <dfn>Number of days between each paycheck event trigger.</dfn>
Paycheck Reference <dfn>Date in YYYY-MM-DD format to calculate the paycheck intervals from in order to maintain consistency and predictability.</dfn>
Maximum amount of warning points
Below minimum warning points
Choose what should happen if the amount of warning points is below the minimum.
Minimum amount of warning points
Test Payments <dfn>If yes, this will enable debugging for all Purchase events.</dfn>
Rebuildable <dfn>This event trigger can calculate old transactions from past records maintained in the database.</dfn>

Reference Format <dfn>If this action stores reference IDs, then this is the base URL to link to the item involved in the action. It should assume it is in the forum root and the reference ID will be appended to it.</dfn>
Reversible <dfn>If yes, events can be undone later which negates the effect of the event.</dfn>
(Pro) Defintion of Old Thread <dfn>Time in seconds since the last reply before a thread is considered "old".</dfn>
Event Trigger Settings
Maximum amount of stars
Below minimum stars
Choose what should happen if the amount of stars is below the minimum.
Minimum amount of stars
Taxation Interval <dfn>Number of days between each taxation event trigger.</dfn>
Taxation Reference <dfn>Date in YYYY-MM-DD format to calculate the taxation intervals from in order to maintain consistency and predictability.</dfn>
Taxation User <dfn>If you wish to send the taxed amount to another user, enter the user name here.</dfn>

Exchange rate

The value of your DragonByte Credits currency vs. the real-world cost of whatever item you apply this payment profile to.
For example, if this payment profile is added to a User Upgrade that costs $4.99 and you set this number to 100, the user will be charged 499 points.

Negation amount per character

If not charging: Removed for each character along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each character along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.

If not charging: Removed for each word along with the event negation amount when this event is reverted.
If charging: Restored for each word along with the event negation amount every time this event is reverted.

Event triggering
Enable events
Charge event trigger: Content tag
Charge event trigger: Currency
Donate event trigger: Currency rounding
Interest event trigger: Interval
Conversation event trigger: Trigger event for all participants

DragonByte Credits License Key
Navbar tab
Size multipliers
Transactions per page

If enabled, a negation event trigger (f.ex. a post being deleted) will delete the existing transaction instead of inserting a new transaction. This does not work for all event triggers.
If multiple transactions are found, it will negate the event using a new transaction instead.
You can also override this feature by setting the "Negation amount" to a value other than 0.
If more than one event per currency applies to a situation, choose whether the highest amount or all of them will be triggered.
Master toggle for all events should you want to temporarily disable the whole system. Does not disable Displays.

This BBCode will be used for designating charged content. Change this to something else to take over the tags from other content hiding plugins. Blank out this setting to disable the charged content functionality, which would expose such content for free.
The currency that will be used for charged content transactions. Make sure corresponding events are set to use this currency as well.

To ease rounding issues, you can set a number of decimals that the target currency will be rounded up to that adjusts the source currency amounts accordingly when transferring or donating currency.
Use 0 for whole number amounts.
Number of days between each interest event trigger.
If unchecked, the event will only occur once no matter how many recipients are attached to a single message.
Number of days between each paycheck event trigger.
The currency you're selling your credits in.
Time (in seconds) since the last reply before a thread is considered "old".
Number of days between each taxation event trigger.
If you wish to send the taxed amount to another user, enter the user name here.
This is the license key associated with your product. Removing this will affect your ability to use the free "Product Manager" product to check for updates.
Choose whether it's the number of words or number of characters in a message that will be used for size multipliers. This only affects certain event triggers.
The currency page lists the latest transactions for each user. This is the number of transactions to show before splitting to the next page.
